body:
# NATS

NATS is a message broker for distributed systems.

## Installation

1. Add the dependency to your `shard.yml`:

   ```yaml
   dependencies:
     nats:
       github: jgaskins/nats
   ```

2. Run `shards install`

## Usage

You can use NATS in a publish/subscribe or request/reply paradigm.

### Publish/Subscribe

For publish/subscribe, let's consider the following class to be shared, representing an event that will be published by one service and picked up by another:

```crystal
require "uuid"
require "json"
require "uuid/json"

struct UserRegisteredEvent
  include JSON::Serializable

  getter id : UUID
  getter email : String
  getter name : String

  def initialize(@id, @email, @name)
  end
end
```

In one service, we can subscribe to a subject that will be sent all of the events pertaining to a user registering:

```crystal
require "nats"

nats = NATS::Client.new(URI.parse(ENV["NATS_URL"]))

# Subscribe to all messages on "customers.registration" with an optional queue
# group. A message will only be delivered to a single client in a given queue
# group.
nats.subscribe "customers.registration", queue_group: "cart-service" do |msg|
  new_user = UserRegisteredEvent.from_json(msg.body_io)

  # This message represents that a new customer has registered, presumably sent
  # by our identity/authentication/user service. We create a record for this
  # customer in our own database so we don't always need to request the info
  # from that service.
  UserQuery.new.create_from_message(new_user)
end

# Accept wildcard messages. This would match:
# - orders.commercial.fulfilled
# - orders.individual.fulfilled
nats.subscribe "orders.*.shipped", queue_group: "cart-service" do |msg|
  # ...
end

# Since the subscribe blocks above do not block execution, we need to keep the
# main fiber from exiting. In a real-world app, you might trap a TERM/INT signal
# to allow the app to close the connection gracefully.
sleep
```

And then to publish on those topics:

```crystal
require "nats"

nats = NATS::Client.new(URI.parse(ENV["NATS_URL"]))

# We can publish a message with a given subject. In this example, we'll
# publish a message saying Jolene has registered.
nats.publish "customers.registration", UserRegisteredEvent.new(
  id: UUID.random,
  name: "Jolene",
  email: "jolene@gonnatakeyourman.com",
)

nats.close
```

### Request/Reply

Let's consider an orders service that we may want to send requests to.

```crystal
require "uuid"
require "json"
require "uuid/json"
require "db"

module Orders
  struct Get
    include JSON::Serializable

    getter id : UUID

    def initialize(@id)
    end
  end
end

struct Order
  include DB::Serializable
  include JSON::Serializable

  getter id : UUID
  getter address : String
  getter city : String
  getter state : String
  getter postal_code : String
end
```

#### Define the request handler

```crystal
require "nats"

nats = NATS::Client.new(URI.parse(ENV["NATS_URL"]))

# Subscribe to the subject that the request will be sent to
nats.subscribe "orders.get", do |msg|
  request = Orders::Get.from_json(msg.body_io)

  order = OrderQuery.new.with_id(request.id)

  nats.reply msg, order.to_json
end
```

#### Sending the request

```crystal
require "nats"

nats = NATS::Client.new(URI.parse(ENV["NATS_URL"]))

# Send the request to the subject it is expected to be received on:
order = nats.request "orders.get",
  message: Orders::Get.new(order_id).to_json,
  timeout: 5.seconds # A timeout must be specified

pp order
```

## Development

TODO: Write development instructions here

## Contributing

1. Fork it (<https://github.com/jgaskins/nats/fork>)
2. Create your feature branch (`git checkout -b my-new-feature`)
3. Commit your changes (`git commit -am 'Add some feature'`)
4. Push to the branch (`git push origin my-new-feature`)
5. Create a new Pull Request

## Contributors

- [Jamie Gaskins](https://github.com/jgaskins) - creator and maintainer

types.name: NATS
types.doc:
NATS is a pub/sub message bus.

```
require "nats"

# Connect to a NATS server running on localhost
nats = NATS::Client.new

# Connect to a single remote NATS server
nats = NATS::Client.new(URI.parse(ENV["NATS_URL"]))

# Connect to a NATS cluster, specified by the NATS_URLS environment variable
# as a comma-separated list of URLs
servers = ENV["NATS_URLS"]
  .split(',')
  .map { |url| URI.parse(url) }
nats = NATS::Client.new(servers: %w[
  nats://nats-1
  nats://nats-2
  nats://nats-3
])
```
types.summary: NATS is a pub/sub message bus.

types.name: Client
types.doc:
Instantiating a `NATS::Client` makes a connection to one of the given NATS
servers.
types.summary: Instantiating a NATS::Client makes a connection to one of the given NATS servers.

constructors.name: new
constructors.doc:
Connect to a single NATS server at the given URI

```
nats = NATS::Client.new(URI.parse("nats://nats.example.com"))
```
constructors.summary: Connect to a single NATS server at the given URI

constructors.name: new
constructors.doc:
Connect to a NATS cluster at the given URIs

```
nats = NATS::Client.new([
  URI.parse("nats://nats-1.example.com"),
  URI.parse("nats://nats-2.example.com"),
  URI.parse("nats://nats-3.example.com"),
])
```
constructors.summary: Connect to a NATS cluster at the given URIs
constructors.args_html: (servers : Array(URI), ping_interval : Time::Span = 2.minutes, max_pings_out = 2)

def.name: new

instance_methods.name: close
instance_methods.doc:
Close this NATS connection. This should be done explicitly before exiting
the program so that the NATS server can remove any subscriptions that were
associated with this client.
instance_methods.summary: Close this NATS connection.

def.name: close
def.body:
begin
  if @state.closed?
    return
  end
  LOG.debug do
    "Flushing before closing..."
  end
  flush
  @socket.close
  @state = :closed
  LOG.debug do
    "Connection closed"
  end
rescue IO::Error
end

instance_methods.name: flush
instance_methods.doc: Flush the client's output buffer over the wire
instance_methods.summary: Flush the client's output buffer over the wire

def.name: flush
def.body:
channel = Channel(Nil).new(1)
ping(channel)
LOG.debug do
  "Flushing buffer..."
end
@out.synchronize do
  @socket.flush
end
Fiber.yield
select
when channel.receive
when timeout(timeout)
  raise(Error.new("Flush did not complete within duration: #{timeout}"))
end

instance_methods.name: jetstream
instance_methods.doc:
Returns a `NATS::JetStream::Client` that uses this client's connection to
the NATS server.
instance_methods.summary: Returns a NATS::JetStream::Client that uses this client's connection to the NATS server.

instance_methods.name: kv
instance_methods.doc:
Returns a `NATS::KV::Client` that uses this client's connection to
the NATS server.
instance_methods.summary:
Returns a NATS::KV::Client that uses this client's connection to the NATS server.

EXPERIMENTAL NATS KV support is experimental and subject to change as NATS support for it changes

instance_methods.name: on_disconnect
instance_methods.doc:
Execute the given block whenever this client is disconnected from the NATS
server.

```
nats = NATS::Client.new
nats.on_disconnect { Datadog.metrics.increment "nats.disconnect" }
```
instance_methods.summary: Execute the given block whenever this client is disconnected from the NATS server.

instance_methods.name: on_error
instance_methods.doc:
Execute the given block whenever an exception is raised inside this NATS
client.

```
nats = NATS::Client.new
nats.on_error { |error| Honeybadger.notify error }
```
instance_methods.summary: Execute the given block whenever an exception is raised inside this NATS client.

instance_methods.name: on_reconnect
instance_methods.doc:
Execute the given block whenever this client is reconnected to the NATS
server.

```
nats = NATS::Client.new
nats.on_reconnect { Datadog.metrics.increment "nats.reconnect" }
```
instance_methods.summary: Execute the given block whenever this client is reconnected to the NATS server.

def.name: ping

instance_methods.name: publish
instance_methods.doc:
Publish the given message body (either `Bytes` for binary data or `String` for text) on the given NATS subject, optionally supplying a `reply_to` subject (if expecting a reply or to notify the receiver where to send updates) and any `headers`.

```
# Send an empty message to a subject
nats.publish "hello"

# Serialize an object to a subject
nats.publish "orders.#{order.id}", order.to_json

# Tell a recipient where to send results. For example, to stream results
# to a given subject:
reply_subject = "replies.orders.list.customer.123"
orders = [] of Order
nats.subscribe reply_subject do |msg|
  case result = (Order | Complete).from_json(String.new(msg.body))
  in Order
    orders << result
  in Complete
    nats.unsubscribe reply_subject
  end
end
nats.publish "orders.list.customer.123", reply_to: reply_subject

# Publish a message to NATS JetStream with a message-deduplication header
# for idempotency:
nats.jetstream.subscribe consumer_subject, queue_group: "my-service" do |msg|
  # ...
end
nats.publish orders_subject, order.to_json, headers: NATS::Message::Headers{
  # Deduplicate using the equivalent of a cache key
  "Nats-Msg-Id" => "order-submitted-#{order.id}-#{order.updated_at.to_json}",
}
```
instance_methods.summary: Publish the given message body (either Bytes for binary data or String for text) on the given NATS subject, optionally supplying a reply_to subject (if expecting a reply or to notify the receiver where to send updates) and any headers.
instance_methods.args_string: (subject : String, message : Data = Bytes.empty, reply_to : String? = nil, headers : Message::Headers? = nil) : Nil
instance_methods.args_html: (subject : String, message : Data = Bytes.empty, reply_to : String? = nil, headers : Message::Headers? = nil) : Nil

def.name: publish
def.body:
if message.bytesize > MAX_PUBLISH_SIZE
  raise(Error.new("Attempted to publish message of size #{message.bytesize}. Cannot publish messages larger than #{MAX_PUBLISH_SIZE}."))
end
LOG.debug do
  "Publishing #{message.bytesize} bytes to #{subject.inspect}, reply_to: #{reply_to.inspect}, headers: #{headers.inspect}"
end
write do
  if headers
    @io << "HPUB "
  else
    @io << "PUB "
  end
  @io << subject
  if reply_to
    (@io << ' ') << reply_to
  end
  if headers
    nats_header_preamble = "NATS/1.0\r\n"
    initial_header_length = nats_header_preamble.bytesize + 2
    header_length = headers.reduce(initial_header_length) do |bytes, __arg1|
      key = __arg1[0]
      value = __arg1[1]
      bytes = bytes + ((key.bytesize + value.bytesize) + 4)
    end
    (@io << ' ') << header_length
    ((@io << ' ') << (header_length + message.bytesize)) << "\r\n"
    @io << nats_header_preamble
    headers.each do |key, value|
      (((@io << key) << ": ") << value) << "\r\n"
    end
    @io << "\r\n"
  else
    ((@io << ' ') << message.bytesize) << "\r\n"
  end
  @io.write(message.to_slice)
  @io << "\r\n"
end

instance_methods.name: reply
instance_methods.doc:
Send the given `body` to the `msg`'s `reply_to` subject, often used in a
request/reply messaging model.

```
nats.subscribe "orders.*", queue_group: "orders-service" do |msg|
  _, id = msg.subject.split('.') # Similar to HTTP path routing

  if order = OrderQuery.new.find_by(id: id)
    nats.reply msg, {order: order}.to_json
  else
    nats.reply msg, {error: "No order with that id found"}.to_json
  end
end
```
instance_methods.summary: Send the given body to the msg's reply_to subject, often used in a request/reply messaging model.

def.name: reply
def.body:
if subject = msg.reply_to
  publish(subject, body)
else
  raise(NotAReply.new("Cannot reply to a message that has no return address", msg))
end

instance_methods.name: request
instance_methods.doc:
Make a synchronous request to subscribers of the given `subject`, waiting
up to `timeout` for a response from any of the subscribers. The first
message to come back will be returned. If no messages comes back before
the `timeout` elapses, `nil` is returned.

```
if order_response = nats.request("orders.info.#{order_id}")
  response << Order.from_json(String.new(order_response.body))
else
  response.status = :service_unavailable
end
```
instance_methods.summary: Make a synchronous request to subscribers of the given subject, waiting up to timeout for a response from any of the subscribers.
instance_methods.args_string: (subject : String, message : Data = "", timeout : Time::Span = 2.seconds, headers : Headers? = nil) : Message?
instance_methods.args_html: (subject : String, message : Data = "", timeout : Time::Span = 2.seconds, headers : Headers? = nil) : Message?

def.name: request
def.body:
channel = Channel(Message).new(1)
inbox = Random::Secure.hex(4)
key = "#{@inbox_prefix}.#{inbox}"
@inbox_handlers[key] = ->(msg : Message) do
  channel.send(msg)
end
publish(subject, message, reply_to: key, headers: headers)
@out.synchronize do
  @socket.flush
end
begin
  select
when msg = channel.receive
    msg
when timeout(timeout)
    nil
end

ensure
  @inbox_handlers.delete(key)
end

instance_methods.name: request
instance_methods.doc:
Make an asynchronous request to subscribers of the given `subject`, not
waiting for a response. The first message to come back will be passed to
the block.
instance_methods.summary: Make an asynchronous request to subscribers of the given subject, not waiting for a response.
instance_methods.args_string: (subject : String, message : Data = "", timeout = 2.seconds, &block : Message -> ) : Nil
instance_methods.args_html: (subject : String, message : Data = "", timeout = 2.seconds, &block : Message -> ) : Nil

def.name: request
def.body:
inbox = Random::Secure.hex(4)
key = "#{@inbox_prefix}.#{inbox}"
@inbox_handlers[key] = ->(msg : Message) do
  block.call(msg)
  @inbox_handlers.delete(key)
end
publish(subject, message, reply_to: key)
spawn(remove_key(key, after: timeout))

instance_methods.name: state
instance_methods.doc: The current state of the connection
instance_methods.summary: The current state of the connection

instance_methods.name: subscribe
instance_methods.doc:
Subscribe to the given `subject`, optionally with a `queue_group` (so that
each message is delivered to this application once instead of once for
each instance of the application), executing the given block for each
message.

```
require "nats"

nats = NATS::Client.new
nats.subscribe "orders.created" do |msg|
  order = Order.from_json(String.new(msg.body))

  # ...
end
```
instance_methods.summary: Subscribe to the given subject, optionally with a queue_group (so that each message is delivered to this application once instead of once for each instance of the application), executing the given block for each message.
instance_methods.args_string: (subject : String, queue_group : String? = nil, sid = @current_sid.add(1), &block : Message, Subscription -> ) : Subscription
instance_methods.args_html: (subject : String, queue_group : String? = nil, sid = @current_sid.add(1), &block : Message, Subscription -> ) : Subscription

def.name: subscribe
def.body:
LOG.debug do
  "Subscribing to #{subject.inspect}, queue_group: #{queue_group.inspect}, sid: #{sid}"
end
write do
  ((@io << "SUB ") << subject) << ' '
  if queue_group
    (@io << queue_group) << ' '
  end
  (@io << sid) << "\r\n"
end
@subscriptions[sid] = (Subscription.new(subject, sid, queue_group, &block)).tap(&.start)

instance_methods.name: unsubscribe
instance_methods.doc: Unsubscribe from the given subscription after the specified number of messages has been received.
instance_methods.summary: Unsubscribe from the given subscription after the specified number of messages has been received.

instance_methods.name: unsubscribe
instance_methods.doc:
Unsubscribe from the given subscription

```
nats = NATS::Client.new

new_orders = [] of NATS::Message
subscription = nats.subscribe "orders.created.*" do |msg|
  messages << msg
end

spawn do
  sleep 10.seconds
  nats.unsubscribe subscription
end
```
instance_methods.summary: Unsubscribe from the given subscription

types.name: ClientClosed
types.doc:
Raised when an attempt is made to communicate with the NATS server using
a client instance that has been explicitly closed.
types.summary: Raised when an attempt is made to communicate with the NATS server using a client instance that has been explicitly closed.

types.name: State

constants.name: Connecting
constants.doc:
The connection is currently awaiting a completed NATS connection. We
could be awaiting TCP, TLS, NATS protocol handshake, synchronization,
etc. Ideally, a client doesn't spend more than a few milliseconds in
this state.
constants.summary: The connection is currently awaiting a completed NATS connection.

constants.name: Connected
constants.doc: A successful NATS connection has been made.
constants.summary: A successful NATS connection has been made.

constants.name: Disconnected
constants.doc:
The client has been disconnected and is either currently executing its
disconnect handler or is waiting on the reconnect backoff period.
constants.summary: The client has been disconnected and is either currently executing its disconnect handler or is waiting on the reconnect backoff period.

constants.name: Reconnecting
constants.doc:
The disconnect handler has been invoked, the backoff period has elapsed
and the client is currenty attempting to reconnect to the NATS server.
constants.summary: The disconnect handler has been invoked, the backoff period has elapsed and the client is currenty attempting to reconnect to the NATS server.

constants.name: Closed
constants.doc: The client has been explicitly closed with `NATS::Client#close`.
constants.summary: The client has been explicitly closed with NATS::Client#close.

types.doc: The current state of the client's connection
types.summary: The current state of the client's connection

types.name: Error
types.doc: Generic error
types.summary: Generic error

types.name: JetStream
types.doc:
NATS JetStream provides at-least-once delivery guarantees with the
possibility of exactly-once for some use cases, allowing NATS to be used for
scenarios where 100% delivery of messages and events is required.
types.summary: NATS JetStream provides at-least-once delivery guarantees with the possibility of exactly-once for some use cases, allowing NATS to be used for scenarios where 100% delivery of messages and events is required.

instance_methods.name: ack_floor
instance_methods.doc: The number of messages that have been acknowledged for this consumer/stream
instance_methods.summary: The number of messages that have been acknowledged for this consumer/stream

instance_methods.name: cluster
instance_methods.doc: Where this consumer's data lives in the cluster
instance_methods.summary: Where this consumer's data lives in the cluster

instance_methods.name: config
instance_methods.doc: The configuration used to create this consumer (including its defaults)
instance_methods.summary: The configuration used to create this consumer (including its defaults)

instance_methods.name: created
instance_methods.doc: The timestamp when this consumer was created
instance_methods.summary: The timestamp when this consumer was created

instance_methods.name: delivered
instance_methods.doc: The number of times this consumer has delivered messages for this stream
instance_methods.summary: The number of times this consumer has delivered messages for this stream

instance_methods.name: name
instance_methods.doc: The name of this consumer
instance_methods.summary: The name of this consumer

instance_methods.name: num_ack_pending
instance_methods.doc: The number of messages currently in-flight that are awaiting acknowledgement
instance_methods.summary: The number of messages currently in-flight that are awaiting acknowledgement

instance_methods.name: num_pending
instance_methods.doc: The number of messages in the stream that this consumer has not delivered at all yet
instance_methods.summary: The number of messages in the stream that this consumer has not delivered at all yet

instance_methods.name: num_redelivered
instance_methods.doc: The number of messages that have been redelivered
instance_methods.summary: The number of messages that have been redelivered

instance_methods.name: num_waiting
instance_methods.doc: The number of messages that are currently waiting
instance_methods.summary: The number of messages that are currently waiting

instance_methods.name: stream_name
instance_methods.doc: The name of the stream this consumer sources its messages from
instance_methods.summary: The name of the stream this consumer sources its messages from

types.name: Sequence
types.doc:
The sequence represense a cursor for how many messages have been
delivered or acknowledged for this consumer and stream.
types.summary: The sequence represense a cursor for how many messages have been delivered or acknowledged for this consumer and stream.

constructors.name: new
constructors.doc:
The sequence represense a cursor for how many messages have been
delivered or acknowledged for this consumer and stream.
constructors.summary: The sequence represense a cursor for how many messages have been delivered or acknowledged for this consumer and stream.

constructors.name: new
constructors.args_string: (deliver_subject = nil, durable_name = nil, ack_policy : AckPolicy = :explicit, deliver_policy : DeliverPolicy = :all, replay_policy : ReplayPolicy = :instant, ack_wait = nil, filter_subject = nil, max_deliver = nil, opt_start_seq = nil, sample_frequency = nil, opt_start_time = nil, rate_limit_bps = nil, max_ack_pending : Int? = nil, max_waiting : Int? = nil, idle_heartbeat = nil, deliver_group = durable_name)
constructors.args_html: (deliver_subject = nil, durable_name = nil, ack_policy : AckPolicy = :explicit, deliver_policy : DeliverPolicy = :all, replay_policy : ReplayPolicy = :instant, ack_wait = nil, filter_subject = nil, max_deliver = nil, opt_start_seq = nil, sample_frequency = nil, opt_start_time = nil, rate_limit_bps = nil, max_ack_pending : Int? = nil, max_waiting : Int? = nil, idle_heartbeat = nil, deliver_group = durable_name)

def.name: new
def.body:
_ = allocate
_.initialize(deliver_subject, durable_name, ack_policy, deliver_policy, replay_policy, ack_wait, filter_subject, max_deliver, opt_start_seq, sample_frequency, opt_start_time, rate_limit_bps, max_ack_pending, max_waiting, idle_heartbeat, deliver_group)
if _.responds_to?(:finalize)
  ::GC.add_finalizer(_)
end
_

instance_methods.name: ack_policy
instance_methods.doc: AckPolicy	How messages should be acknowledged, AckNone, AckAll or AckExplicit
instance_methods.summary: AckPolicy How messages should be acknowledged, AckNone, AckAll or AckExplicit

instance_methods.name: deliver_policy
instance_methods.doc: DeliverPolicy	The initial starting mode of the consumer, DeliverAll, DeliverLast, DeliverNew, DeliverByStartSequence or DeliverByStartTime
instance_methods.summary: DeliverPolicy The initial starting mode of the consumer, DeliverAll, DeliverLast, DeliverNew, DeliverByStartSequence or DeliverByStartTime

instance_methods.name: deliver_subject
instance_methods.doc: DeliverySubject	The subject to deliver observed messages, when not set, a pull-based Consumer is created
instance_methods.summary: DeliverySubject The subject to deliver observed messages, when not set, a pull-based Consumer is created

instance_methods.name: durable_name
instance_methods.doc: Durable	The name of the Consumer
instance_methods.summary: Durable The name of the Consumer

instance_methods.name: filter_subject
instance_methods.doc: FilterSubject	When consuming from a Stream with many subjects, or wildcards, select only a specific incoming subjects, supports wildcards
instance_methods.summary: FilterSubject When consuming from a Stream with many subjects, or wildcards, select only a specific incoming subjects, supports wildcards

instance_methods.name: max_ack_pending
instance_methods.doc: MaxAckPending	The maximum number of messages without acknowledgement that can be outstanding, once this limit is reached message delivery will be suspended
instance_methods.summary: MaxAckPending The maximum number of messages without acknowledgement that can be outstanding, once this limit is reached message delivery will be suspended

instance_methods.name: max_deliver
instance_methods.doc: MaxDeliver	Maximum amount times a specific message will be delivered. Use this to avoid poison pills crashing all your services forever
instance_methods.summary: MaxDeliver Maximum amount times a specific message will be delivered.

instance_methods.name: opt_start_seq
instance_methods.doc: OptStartSeq	When first consuming messages from the Stream start at this particular message in the set
instance_methods.summary: OptStartSeq When first consuming messages from the Stream start at this particular message in the set

instance_methods.name: opt_start_time
instance_methods.doc: OptStartTime	When first consuming messages from the Stream start with messages on or after this time
instance_methods.summary: OptStartTime When first consuming messages from the Stream start with messages on or after this time

instance_methods.name: rate_limit_bps
instance_methods.doc: RateLimit	The rate of message delivery in bits per second
instance_methods.summary: RateLimit The rate of message delivery in bits per second

instance_methods.name: replay_policy
instance_methods.doc: ReplayPolicy	How messages are sent ReplayInstant or ReplayOriginal
instance_methods.summary: ReplayPolicy How messages are sent ReplayInstant or ReplayOriginal

instance_methods.name: sample_frequency
instance_methods.doc: SampleFrequency	What percentage of acknowledgements should be samples for observability, 0-100
instance_methods.summary: SampleFrequency What percentage of acknowledgements should be samples for observability, 0-100

types.name: AckPolicy

constants.name: None
constants.doc:
No acknowledgements are required. All messages are considered
acknowledged on delivery.
constants.summary: No acknowledgements are required.

constants.name: All
constants.doc:
Acknowledging a message acknowledges all messages that came before
it.
constants.summary: Acknowledging a message acknowledges all messages that came before it.

constants.name: Explicit
constants.doc:
Every message must be acknowledged individually. This is the
default.
constants.summary: Every message must be acknowledged individually.

types.doc:
The way this consumer expects messages to be acknowledged.

See [AckPolicy in the NATS server code](https://github.com/nats-io/nats-server/blob/3aa8e63b290ac4ba1c99193827b3f66ad5679904/server/consumer.go#L136-L143)
types.summary: The way this consumer expects messages to be acknowledged.

types.name: DeliverPolicy

constants.name: All
constants.doc: Deliver _all_ messages from a stream via this consumer
constants.summary: Deliver all messages from a stream via this consumer

constants.name: Last
constants.doc:
Start from the current last message in the stream when this
consumer was created
constants.summary: Start from the current last message in the stream when this consumer was created

constants.name: New
constants.doc:
Start _after_ the current last message in the stream when this
consumer was created. This is different from `Last` in that it
will not begin delivering messages until more are published.
constants.summary: Start after the current last message in the stream when this consumer was created.

constants.name: ByStartSequence
constants.doc:
Start delivery at the sequence in the stream denoted by
`opt_start_seq`. `opt_start_seq` is _required_ when this
`DeliverPolicy` is used.
constants.summary: Start delivery at the sequence in the stream denoted by opt_start_seq.

constants.name: ByStartTime
constants.doc:
Start delivery at the first message whose `timestamp` is equal to
or later than `opt_start_time`. `opt_start_time` is _required
when this `DeliverPolicy` is used.
constants.summary: Start delivery at the first message whose timestamp is equal to or later than opt_start_time.

constants.name: LastPerSubject
constants.doc: Similar to `Last`, but on a per-subject basis.
constants.summary: Similar to Last, but on a per-subject basis.

constants.name: Undefined
constants.doc:
If you've got this set, something's probably borked. This value
only exists in this client because [the server can send it](https://github.com/nats-io/nats-server/blob/3aa8e63b290ac4ba1c99193827b3f66ad5679904/server/consumer.go#L118-L119).
constants.summary: If you've got this set, something's probably borked.

types.doc:
Where to begin consuming messages from a stream.

See [DeliverPolicy in the NATS server code](https://github.com/nats-io/nats-server/blob/3aa8e63b290ac4ba1c99193827b3f66ad5679904/server/consumer.go#L105-L120)
types.summary: Where to begin consuming messages from a stream.

types.name: ReplayPolicy

constants.name: Instant
constants.doc: Tells the NATS server to deliver messages immediately
constants.summary: Tells the NATS server to deliver messages immediately

constants.name: Original
constants.doc:
Tells the NATS server to deliver messages at the rate they were
originally published.
constants.summary: Tells the NATS server to deliver messages at the rate they were originally published.

types.doc:
A consumer's `replay_policy` is the pace at which to replay messages
from a stream.

See [ReplayPolicy in the NATS server code](https://github.com/nats-io/nats-server/blob/3aa8e63b290ac4ba1c99193827b3f66ad5679904/server/consumer.go#L157-L162)
types.summary: A consumer's replay_policy is the pace at which to replay messages from a stream.

instance_methods.name: each
instance_methods.doc: Must yield this collection's elements to the block.
instance_methods.summary: Must yield this collection's elements to the block.

types.name: Consumers
types.doc:
A NATS JetStream consumer is a message index sourced from a stream.
It can apply additional filters and records which messages are pending,
acknowledged, etc, at the consumer layer.
types.summary: A NATS JetStream consumer is a message index sourced from a stream.

instance_methods.name: create
instance_methods.doc:
Create a consumer for the given stream with the given properties,
which are passed unmodified to `NATS::JetStream::API::V1::Consumer.new`.
instance_methods.summary: Create a consumer for the given stream with the given properties, which are passed unmodified to NATS::JetStream::API::V1::Consumer.new.

def.name: create
def.body:
consumer_config = NATS::JetStream::API::V1::ConsumerConfig.new(**properties, deliver_policy: deliver_policy)
create_consumer = {stream_name: stream_name, config: consumer_config}
if durable_name = consumer_config.durable_name
  create_consumer_subject = "$JS.API.CONSUMER.DURABLE.CREATE.#{stream_name}.#{durable_name}"
else
  create_consumer_subject = "$JS.API.CONSUMER.CREATE.#{stream_name}"
end
if response = @nats.request(create_consumer_subject, create_consumer.to_json)
else
  raise(JetStream::Error.new("Did not receive a response from NATS JetStream"))
end
case parsed = (Consumer | ErrorResponse).from_json(String.new(response.body))
in Consumer
  parsed
in ErrorResponse
  raise(JetStream::Error.new("#{parsed.error.description} (#{parsed.error.code})"))
end

instance_methods.name: delete
instance_methods.doc:
Delete the consumer with the given name associated with the stream
with the given name.
instance_methods.summary: Delete the consumer with the given name associated with the stream with the given name.

instance_methods.name: delete
instance_methods.doc: Delete the given consumer for the given stream
instance_methods.summary: Delete the given consumer for the given stream

instance_methods.name: info
instance_methods.doc:
Return the consumer with the specified `name` associated with the
given stream.
instance_methods.summary: Return the consumer with the specified name associated with the given stream.

def.name: info
def.body:
if consumer_response = @nats.request("$JS.API.CONSUMER.INFO.#{stream_name}.#{name}")
  NATS::JetStream::API::V1::Consumer.from_json(String.new(consumer_response.body))
else
  raise("no info for #{name.inspect} (stream #{stream_name.inspect})")
end

instance_methods.name: list
instance_methods.doc:
Returns a paginated list of consumers for the stream with the
specified name.
instance_methods.summary: Returns a paginated list of consumers for the stream with the specified name.

instance_methods.name: list
instance_methods.doc: Returns a paginated list of consumers for the specified stream.
instance_methods.summary: Returns a paginated list of consumers for the specified stream.

constructors.name: new
constructors.args_string: (name, subjects, description = nil, max_age = nil, max_bytes = nil, max_msg_size = nil, max_msgs = nil, max_msgs_per_subject = nil, max_consumers = nil, no_ack = false, replicas = nil, retention : RetentionPolicy? = nil, allow_rollup_headers = nil, deny_delete = nil, discard : DiscardPolicy? = nil, storage : Storage = :file)
constructors.args_html: (name, subjects, description = nil, max_age = nil, max_bytes = nil, max_msg_size = nil, max_msgs = nil, max_msgs_per_subject = nil, max_consumers = nil, no_ack = false, replicas = nil, retention : RetentionPolicy? = nil, allow_rollup_headers = nil, deny_delete = nil, discard : DiscardPolicy? = nil, storage : Storage = :file)

def.name: new
def.body:
_ = allocate
_.initialize(name, subjects, description, max_age, max_bytes, max_msg_size, max_msgs, max_msgs_per_subject, max_consumers, no_ack, replicas, retention, allow_rollup_headers, deny_delete, discard, storage)
if _.responds_to?(:finalize)
  ::GC.add_finalizer(_)
end
_

instance_methods.name: name
instance_methods.doc: Name of this stream
instance_methods.summary: Name of this stream

instance_methods.name: subjects
instance_methods.doc: Which subjects this stream will listen for.
instance_methods.summary: Which subjects this stream will listen for.

types.name: DiscardPolicy

constants.name: Old
constants.doc:
Drop old messages when the stream has reached a count or volume
limit
constants.summary: Drop old messages when the stream has reached a count or volume limit

constants.name: New
constants.doc: Don't add new messages until old ones are discarded
constants.summary: Don't add new messages until old ones are discarded

types.doc:
The `DiscardPolicy` tells the NATS server which end of the stream to
truncate when the stream is full  should we start dropping old
messages or avoid adding new ones?
types.summary: The DiscardPolicy tells the NATS server which end of the stream to truncate when the stream is full should we start dropping old messages or avoid adding new ones?

types.name: RetentionPolicy

constants.name: Limits
constants.doc:
Discard messages when the stream has reached the limit of either
the number of messages or the total stream size in bytes, or the
message's max age has passed.
constants.summary: Discard messages when the stream has reached the limit of either the number of messages or the total stream size in bytes, or the message's max age has passed.

constants.name: Interest
constants.doc:
Discard a message when all subscribed consumers have acknowledged
it to guarantee delivery but not keep the message in memory. This
is the default behavior of AMQP.
constants.summary: Discard a message when all subscribed consumers have acknowledged it to guarantee delivery but not keep the message in memory.

constants.name: Workqueue
constants.doc:
Discard a message when the first consumer has acknowledged it, as
in a work queue like Sidekiq.
constants.summary: Discard a message when the first consumer has acknowledged it, as in a work queue like Sidekiq.

types.doc:
The `RetentionPolicy` tells the NATS server when messages can be
discarded. Your options are to wait until the a quantity/volume/time
limit has been reached, _all_ consumers have acknowledged, or _any_
consumers have acknowledged.

```
jetstream.stream.create(
  # ...
  retention: :workqueue,
)
```
types.summary: The RetentionPolicy tells the NATS server when messages can be discarded.

types.name: Storage

constants.name: Memory
constants.doc:
Store messages in memory. This is the fastest, but is not durable.
If the NATS server is restarted for any reason, the stream will
be dropped. Using this option may also increase the amount of
memory required by your NATS server. Use with caution.
constants.summary: Store messages in memory.

constants.name: File
constants.doc:
Store messages on disk. Always use this if your system depends on
100% delivery.
constants.summary: Store messages on disk.

types.doc:
The `Storage` parameter tells the NATS server how to store the
messages in the stream.
types.summary: The Storage parameter tells the NATS server how to store the messages in the stream.

def.name: from_json
def.body:
if string = json.read_string_or_null
  raw = Base64.decode_string(string)
  header_count = (raw.count('\n')) - 2
  headers = Headers.new(initial_capacity: header_count)
  raw.each_line do |line|
    if separator_index = line.index(':')
      key = line[0...separator_index]
      value = line[(separator_index + 2)..]
      headers[key] = value
    end
  end
  headers
end

instance_methods.name: each
instance_methods.doc: Must yield this collection's elements to the block.
instance_methods.summary: Must yield this collection's elements to the block.

types.name: Streams
types.doc:
A stream in NATS JetStream represents the history of messages
pertaining to a given domain. When you publish a message to a subject
that a stream is monitoring, the stream then adds that message to its
history in the order it was published.
types.summary: A stream in NATS JetStream represents the history of messages pertaining to a given domain.

instance_methods.name: create
instance_methods.doc:
Create a stream of the given storage type and with the given
properties, which are passed unmodified to
`NATS::JetStream::API::V1::StreamConfig.new`.
instance_methods.summary: Create a stream of the given storage type and with the given properties, which are passed unmodified to NATS::JetStream::API::V1::StreamConfig.new.

def.name: create
def.body:
begin
  create_stream = JetStream::API::V1::StreamConfig.new(**kwargs, storage: storage, retention: retention)
  if create_stream.name.includes?('.')
    raise(JetStream::Error.new("Cannot create stream with '.' in the name"))
  end
  if response = @nats.request("$JS.API.STREAM.CREATE.#{create_stream.name}", create_stream.to_json)
    case parsed = (JetStream::API::V1::Stream | ErrorResponse).from_json(String.new(response.body))
    when ErrorResponse
      raise(JetStream::Error.new("#{parsed.error.description} (#{parsed.error.code})"))
    else
      parsed
    end
  else
    raise(JetStream::Error.new("Did not receive a response from NATS JetStream"))
  end
rescue ex
  raise(ex)
end

instance_methods.name: delete
instance_methods.doc: Delete the stream with the given name
instance_methods.summary: Delete the stream with the given name

instance_methods.name: delete
instance_methods.doc: Delete the given stream
instance_methods.summary: Delete the given stream

instance_methods.name: info
instance_methods.doc: Get the current state of the stream with the given `name`
instance_methods.summary: Get the current state of the stream with the given name

def.name: info
def.body:
if response = @nats.request("$JS.API.STREAM.INFO.#{name}")
  case parsed = (Stream | ErrorResponse).from_json(String.new(response.body))
  in Stream
    parsed
  in ErrorResponse
    if parsed.error.err_code.stream_not_found?
      nil
    else
      raise(Error.new(parsed.error.description))
    end
  end
else
  raise(Error.new("Response timed out while fetching stream #{name.inspect}"))
end

instance_methods.name: list
instance_methods.doc: List all available streams
instance_methods.summary: List all available streams

types.name: Client
types.doc:
This class provides a client for NATS JetStream for at-least-once delivery.
You can either instantiate it with a NATS client or with the
`NATS::Client#jetstream` method as a shortcut.
types.summary: This class provides a client for NATS JetStream for at-least-once delivery.

instance_methods.name: ack
instance_methods.doc:
Acknowledge success processing the specified message, usually called at
the end of your subscription block.

```
jetstream.subscribe consumer do |msg|
  # ...

  jetstream.ack msg
end
```
instance_methods.summary: Acknowledge success processing the specified message, usually called at the end of your subscription block.

instance_methods.name: consumer
instance_methods.doc:
Returns an `API::Consumer` instance to interact with the NATS JetStream
API for consumers.
instance_methods.summary: Returns an API::Consumer instance to interact with the NATS JetStream API for consumers.

instance_methods.name: nack
instance_methods.doc:
Negatively acknowledge the processing of a message, typically called
when an exception is raised while processing.

```
jetstream.subscribe consumer do |msg|
  # doing some work

  jetstream.ack msg # Successfully processed

rescue ex
  jetstream.nack msg # Processing was unsuccessful, try again.
end
```

You can also implement exponential backoff by pushing the nack into a
fiber that sleeps for some time before:

```
jetstream.subscribe consumer do |msg|
  # ...

rescue ex
  # Very important to do this in a `spawn`. Do not block the `subscribe`
  # handler for more than 1-2 seconds or the NATS server will see you as
  # a slow client and terminate the connection.
  spawn do
    # Sleep at most for the amount of time that NATS will wait to redeliver
    backoff = {
      (2 ** msg.delivered_count).milliseconds,
      # Cap backoff because NATS will redeliver it before this time anyway
      consumer.config.ack_wait || 30.seconds,
    }.min
    sleep backoff
    jetstream.nack msg
  end
end
```
instance_methods.summary: Negatively acknowledge the processing of a message, typically called when an exception is raised while processing.

instance_methods.name: publish
instance_methods.args_string: (subject : String, body : Data, timeout : Time::Span = 2.seconds, headers : Headers = Headers.new, message_id : String? = nil, expected_last_message_id : String? = nil, expected_last_sequence : Int64? = nil, expected_stream : String? = nil, expected_last_subject_sequence : Int64? = nil)
instance_methods.args_html: (subject : String, body : Data, timeout : Time::Span = 2.seconds, headers : Headers = Headers.new, message_id : String? = nil, expected_last_message_id : String? = nil, expected_last_sequence : Int64? = nil, expected_stream : String? = nil, expected_last_subject_sequence : Int64? = nil)

def.name: publish
def.body:
if message_id
  headers["Nats-Msg-Id"] = message_id
end
if expected_last_message_id
  headers["Nats-Expected-Last-Msg-Id"] = expected_last_message_id
end
if expected_stream
  headers["Nats-Expected-Stream"] = expected_stream
end
if expected_last_sequence
  headers["Nats-Expected-Last-Sequence"] = expected_last_sequence
end
if expected_last_subject_sequence
  headers["Nats-Expected-Last-Subject-Sequence"] = expected_last_subject_sequence
end
if response = @nats.request(subject, body, timeout: timeout, headers: headers)
  (API::V1::PubAck | API::V1::ErrorResponse).from_json(String.new(response.body))
end

instance_methods.name: pull_subscribe
instance_methods.summary: EXPERIMENTAL NATS JetStream pull subscriptions may be unstable

def.name: pull_subscribe
def.body:
uuid = UUID.random
subject = "#{consumer.config.durable_name}.#{uuid}"
channel = Channel(Message).new(backlog)
subscription = @nats.subscribe(subject, queue_group: consumer.config.deliver_group) do |msg|
  channel.send(Message.new(msg))
end
PullSubscription.new(subscription, consumer, channel, @nats)

instance_methods.name: stream
instance_methods.doc:
Returns an `API::Stream` instance to interact with the NATS JetStream
API for streams.
instance_methods.summary: Returns an API::Stream instance to interact with the NATS JetStream API for streams.

instance_methods.name: subscribe
instance_methods.doc:
Subscribe to the given subject with an optional queue group. This is
effectively identical to `NATS::Client#subscribe`, but the message
yielded to the block is a `NATS::JetStream::Message` instead of
a `NATS::Message`.

```
js = nats.jetstream
js.subscribe "orders.*", queue_group: "fulfillment" do |msg|
  # ...

  js.ack msg
end
```

_NOTE:_ If provided, the `queue_group` _must_ be the same as a `Consumer`'s `deliver_group` for NATS server 2.4.0 and above.
instance_methods.summary: Subscribe to the given subject with an optional queue group.

instance_methods.name: subscribe
instance_methods.doc:
Subscribe to messages delivered to the given consumer. Note that this
consumer _must_ be a push-based consumer. Pull-based consumers do not
allow subscriptions because you must explicitly request the next
message.

```
js = nats.jetstream
consumer = js.consumer.info("orders", "fulfillment")
js.subscribe consumer do |msg|
  # ...

  js.ack msg
end
```
instance_methods.summary: Subscribe to messages delivered to the given consumer.

def.name: subscribe
def.body:
if subject = consumer.config.deliver_subject
  subscribe(subject, queue_group: consumer.config.deliver_group, &block)
else
  raise(ArgumentError.new("Consumer is not a push consumer (no `deliver_subject`)"))
end

def.name: new
def.body:
_ = allocate
_.initialize(nats_subscription, consumer, channel, nats)
if _.responds_to?(:finalize)
  ::GC.add_finalizer(_)
end
_

def.name: fetch
def.body:
@nats.publish("$JS.API.CONSUMER.MSG.NEXT.#{consumer.stream_name}.#{consumer.config.durable_name}", message: message_count.to_s, reply_to: @nats_subscription.subject)
msgs = Array(Message).new(initial_capacity: message_count)
message_count.times do
  select
when msg = @channel.receive
    msgs << msg
when timeout(timeout)
    break
end

end
msgs

types.name: Errors

constants.name: None
constants.doc: Should be wide enough?
constants.summary: Should be wide enough?

types.doc: https://github.com/nats-io/nats-server/blob/main/server/errors.json
types.summary: https://github.com/nats-io/nats-server/blob/main/server/errors.json

types.name: Message
types.doc:
A `NATS::JetStream::Message` is very similar to a `NATS::Message` in that
it represents a piece of information published by a NATS client (not
necessarily _this_ NATS client, though). This `Message` type contains more
information, however, such as information about the stream and consumer
it came from, how many times it's been delivered, etc.
types.summary: A NATS::JetStream::Message is very similar to a NATS::Message in that it represents a piece of information published by a NATS client (not necessarily this NATS client, though).

constructors.name: new
constructors.args_string: (stream, consumer, delivered_count, stream_seq, consumer_seq, timestamp, pending, body, subject, reply_to, headers)
constructors.args_html: (stream, consumer, delivered_count, stream_seq, consumer_seq, timestamp, pending, body, subject, reply_to, headers)

def.name: new
def.body:
_ = allocate
_.initialize(stream, consumer, delivered_count, stream_seq, consumer_seq, timestamp, pending, body, subject, reply_to, headers)
if _.responds_to?(:finalize)
  ::GC.add_finalizer(_)
end
_

constructors.name: new
constructors.doc:
Instantiate a `NATS::JetStream::Message` based on a `NATS::Message`.
Used by JetStream subscriptions to build `JetStream::Message`
instances, since JetStream is a layer on top of core NATS.

def.name: new
def.body:
if reply_to = msg.reply_to
  _jetstream, _ack, stream, consumer, delivered_count, stream_seq, consumer_seq, timestamp, pending_messages = reply_to.split('.')
  new(stream: stream, consumer: consumer, delivered_count: delivered_count.to_i64, stream_seq: stream_seq.to_i64, consumer_seq: consumer_seq.to_i64, timestamp: Time::UNIX_EPOCH + timestamp.to_i64.nanoseconds, pending: pending_messages.to_i64, body: msg.body, subject: msg.subject, reply_to: reply_to, headers: msg.headers)
else
  raise(InvalidNATSMessage.new("Message does not have a reply_to set"))
end

instance_methods.name: body
instance_methods.doc:
The original body of the message, encoded as binary. If you need text,
wrap the body in a `String`.

```
jetstream.subscribe consumer do |msg|
  body_string = String.new(msg.body)

  # ...
end
```
instance_methods.summary: The original body of the message, encoded as binary.

instance_methods.name: consumer
instance_methods.doc: The name of the consumer we received this message from
instance_methods.summary: The name of the consumer we received this message from

instance_methods.name: consumer_seq
instance_methods.doc: The position of this message within its consumer, including redeliveries
instance_methods.summary: The position of this message within its consumer, including redeliveries

instance_methods.name: delivered_count
instance_methods.doc:
The number of times this particular message has been delivered by this
consumer, starting at 1
instance_methods.summary: The number of times this particular message has been delivered by this consumer, starting at 1

instance_methods.name: headers
instance_methods.doc:
Any headers that were published with this message, including ones
interpreted by the NATS server, such as `Nats-Msg-Id` for message
deduplication.
instance_methods.summary: Any headers that were published with this message, including ones interpreted by the NATS server, such as Nats-Msg-Id for message deduplication.

instance_methods.name: pending
instance_methods.doc: How many messages follow this message for this consumer
instance_methods.summary: How many messages follow this message for this consumer

instance_methods.name: reply_to
instance_methods.doc: The subject used for acknowledging this message
instance_methods.summary: The subject used for acknowledging this message

instance_methods.name: stream
instance_methods.doc: The name of the stream this message was consumed from
instance_methods.summary: The name of the stream this message was consumed from

instance_methods.name: stream_seq
instance_methods.doc: The position of this message within its stream
instance_methods.summary: The position of this message within its stream

instance_methods.name: subject
instance_methods.doc:
The original subject this message was published to, which can be (and
most likely is) different from the subject it was delivered to
instance_methods.summary: The original subject this message was published to, which can be (and most likely is) different from the subject it was delivered to

instance_methods.name: timestamp
instance_methods.doc: When this message was originally published
instance_methods.summary: When this message was originally published

types.name: KV
types.doc:
`NATS::KV` is an experimental interface to the NATS server's experimental KV
feature.

To use KV:

```
require "nats/kv"

nats = NATS::Client.new
kv = nats.kv

bucket = "my-bucket"
kv.add(bucket)
kv.put bucket, "key", "value"

msg = kv.get(bucket, "key").message
String.new(msg.data) # => "value"
msg.seq              # => 1
```
types.summary: NATS::KV is an experimental interface to the NATS server's experimental KV feature.

instance_methods.doc: Set the value of a key
instance_methods.summary: Set the value of a key

instance_methods.doc:
Get the value of a key, if it exists (not counting `Delete` operations),
stripping away all metadata to return only the value. If you need
metadata such as `revision`, `timestamp`, or `operation`, or if you need
to be able to get deleted keys, you should use `Bucket#get` instead.
instance_methods.summary: Get the value of a key, if it exists (not counting Delete operations), stripping away all metadata to return only the value.

instance_methods.name: create
instance_methods.doc:
Creates the given `key` with the given `value` if and only if the key
does not yet exist.
instance_methods.summary: Creates the given key with the given value if and only if the key does not yet exist.

instance_methods.name: delete
instance_methods.doc:
Deletes the given `key` from the KV store. Inside the NATS server, this
is implemented as adding another message to the stream that signifies
deletion.
instance_methods.summary: Deletes the given key from the KV store.

instance_methods.name: get
instance_methods.doc:
Get the entry for a key as a `KV::Entry` - returns `nil` if the key does
not exist or if it's been deleted with `ignore_deletes` set to `true`.

*Important*: If you do not set `ignore_deletes`, you may get a deleted
key. This is because the keys are stored in a stream and deleting the
key sets an `operation` flag (implemented in the NATS server as a
`KV-Operation` message header) and this method retrieves the last entry
in the stream for this key. `ignore_deletes` simply tells the client to
ignore deleted messages.
instance_methods.summary: Get the entry for a key as a KV::Entry - returns nil if the key does not exist or if it's been deleted with ignore_deletes set to true.

instance_methods.name: get!
instance_methods.doc:
Get the value of a key as a `KV::Entry` - raises `KeyError` if the key
does not exist or if it's been deleted with `ignore_deletes` set to
`true`.
instance_methods.summary: Get the value of a key as a KV::Entry - raises KeyError if the key does not exist or if it's been deleted with ignore_deletes set to true.

def.name: get!
def.body:
if value = get(key, ignore_deletes: ignore_deletes)
  value
else
  raise(KeyError.new("Key #{key.inspect} expected, but not found"))
end

instance_methods.name: history
instance_methods.doc: Get the history
instance_methods.summary: Get the history

instance_methods.name: keys
instance_methods.doc: List all known keys for this bucket, returned as a `Set(String)`.
instance_methods.summary: List all known keys for this bucket, returned as a Set(String).

instance_methods.name: purge
instance_methods.doc:
Purges the given `key` from the KV store. Inside the NATS server, this
is implemented as rolling up all versions of this key into a single
message with its `KV::Entry#operation` value (`KV-Operation` header)
set to `KV::Entry::Operation::Purge`.
instance_methods.summary: Purges the given key from the KV store.

instance_methods.name: put
instance_methods.doc: Set the value of a key
instance_methods.summary: Set the value of a key

instance_methods.name: update
instance_methods.doc:
Updates the given `key` with the given `value` if and only if it exists
and is currently at the given `revision`. If you do not have the latest
revision, this method returns `nil` so you can perform domain-specific
conflict resolution. If you need to set the key regardless of revision,
use `Bucket#put` instead.
instance_methods.summary: Updates the given key with the given value if and only if it exists and is currently at the given revision.

instance_methods.name: watch
instance_methods.doc:
Watch the given key (or wildcard) for changes and yielding them to the
block. By default, this will also yield deleted messages. To avoid that,
pass `ignore_deletes: true`.

```
bucket.watch("session.*") do |entry|
  _prefix, session_id = entry.subject.split('.', 2)
  if entry.operation.deleted?
    # do deleted things
  else
    # the session was updated
  end
end
```

This method blocks until the yielded `Watch` is stopped (use
`watch.stop`), so if you want to run it in the background, you will need
to run this method inside a `spawn` block.

You can also use this method to wait for a specific key to change once:

```
bucket.watch my_key do |entry, watch|
  # react to the key change
ensure
  watch.stop # exit the block
end
```
instance_methods.summary: Watch the given key (or wildcard) for changes and yielding them to the block.

instance_methods.name: create
instance_methods.doc:
Create a key in the given `bucket` with the specified `value`. On
success, `create` returns the new revision number for the key. If the
key already exists, the value will not be set and `nil` is returned.

```
if revision = kv.create("my-bucket", "my-key", "my-value")
  # created
else
  # key already existed and value was not set
end
```
instance_methods.summary: Create a key in the given bucket with the specified value.
instance_methods.args_string: (bucket : String, key : String, value : String | Bytes) : Int64?
instance_methods.args_html: (bucket : String, key : String, value : String | Bytes) : Int64?

def.name: create
def.body:
revision = update(bucket, key, value, revision: 0)
if revision
  revision
else
  if (entry = get(bucket, key)) && (!entry.operation.put?)
    update(bucket, key, value, revision: entry.revision)
  end
end

instance_methods.name: create_bucket
instance_methods.doc: https://github.com/nats-io/nats.go/blob/d7c1d78a50fc9cded3814ae7d7176fa66b73a4b0/kv.go#L295-L307
instance_methods.summary: https://github.com/nats-io/nats.go/blob/d7c1d78a50fc9cded3814ae7d7176fa66b73a4b0/kv.go#L295-L307
instance_methods.args_string: (name : String, description : String = "", *, max_value_size : Int32? = nil, history : UInt8? = nil, ttl : Time::Span? = nil, max_bytes : Int64? = nil, storage : JetStream::API::V1::StreamConfig::Storage = :file, replicas : Int32 = 1, allow_rollup : Bool = true, deny_delete : Bool = true)
instance_methods.args_html: (name : String, description : String = "", *, max_value_size : Int32? = nil, history : UInt8? = nil, ttl : Time::Span? = nil, max_bytes : Int64? = nil, storage : JetStream::API::V1::StreamConfig::Storage = :file, replicas : Int32 = 1, allow_rollup : Bool = true, deny_delete : Bool = true)

def.name: create_bucket
def.body:
if name =~ (/\A[a-zA-Z0-9_-]+\z/)
else
  raise(ArgumentError.new("NATS KV bucket names can only contain alphanumeric characers, underscores, and dashes"))
end
stream = @nats.jetstream.stream.create(name: "KV_#{name}", description: description, subjects: ["$KV.#{name}.>"], max_msgs_per_subject: history.try(&.to_i64), max_bytes: max_bytes, max_age: ttl, max_msg_size: max_value_size, storage: storage, replicas: {replicas, 1}.max, allow_rollup_headers: allow_rollup, deny_delete: deny_delete)
Bucket.new(stream, self)

def.name: delete
def.body:
validate_key!(key)
headers = Headers {"KV-Operation" => "DEL"}
case response = @nats.jetstream.publish("$KV.#{bucket}.#{key}", "", headers: headers)
in JetStream::API::V1::PubAck
  response
in JetStream::API::V1::ErrorResponse
  raise(Error.new(response.error.description))
in Nil
  raise(Error.new("No response received from the NATS server when deleting #{key.inspect} on KV #{bucket.inspect}"))
end

instance_methods.name: get
instance_methods.doc: Get the value associated with the current
instance_methods.summary: Get the value associated with the current
instance_methods.args_string: (bucket : String, key : String, ignore_deletes = false) : Entry?

def.name: get
def.body:
if key == ">"
else
  validate_key!(key)
end
if response = @nats.jetstream.stream.get_msg("KV_#{bucket}", last_by_subject: "$KV.#{bucket}.#{key}")
  operation = Entry::Operation::Put
  case response.message.headers.try do |h|
    h["KV-Operation"]?
  end
  when "DEL"
    operation = Entry::Operation::Delete
  when "PURGE"
    operation = Entry::Operation::Purge
  end
  if ignore_deletes && (!operation.put?)
    return nil
  end
  _, bucket_name, key_name = response.message.subject.split('.', 3)
  get = Entry.new(bucket: bucket_name, key: key_name, value: response.message.data, revision: response.message.seq, created_at: response.message.time, operation: operation)
end

def.name: history
def.body:
history = [] of Entry
if stream = @nats.jetstream.stream.info("KV_#{bucket}")
  if stream.state.messages == 0
    return history
  end
end
watch(bucket, key, include_history: true) do |msg, watch|
  history << msg
  if msg.delta == 0
    watch.stop
  end
end
history

instance_methods.name: keys
instance_methods.doc: Get all of the keys for the given bucket name
instance_methods.summary: Get all of the keys for the given bucket name

def.name: keys
def.body:
keys = Set(String).new
if stream = @nats.jetstream.stream.info("KV_#{bucket}")
  if stream.state.messages == 0
    return keys
  end
end
watch(bucket, ">") do |msg, watch|
  case msg.operation
  when .delete?, .purge?
    keys.delete(msg.key)
  else
    keys << msg.key
  end
  if msg.delta == 0
    watch.stop
  end
end
keys

def.name: purge
def.body:
headers = Headers {"KV-Operation" => "PURGE", "Nats-Rollup" => "sub"}
case response = @nats.jetstream.publish("$KV.#{bucket}.#{key}", "", headers: headers)
in JetStream::API::V1::PubAck
  response
in JetStream::API::V1::ErrorResponse
  raise(Error.new(response.error.description))
in Nil
  raise(Error.new("No response received from the NATS server when purging #{key.inspect} on KV #{bucket.inspect}"))
end

instance_methods.name: put
instance_methods.doc: Assign `value` to `key` in `bucket`.
instance_methods.summary: Assign value to key in bucket.
instance_methods.args_string: (bucket : String, key : String, value : String | Bytes) : Int64
instance_methods.args_html: (bucket : String, key : String, value : String | Bytes) : Int64

def.name: put
def.body:
validate_key!(key)
case response = @nats.jetstream.publish("$KV.#{bucket}.#{key}", value)
in JetStream::API::V1::PubAck
  response.sequence
in JetStream::API::V1::ErrorResponse
  raise(Error.new(response.error.description))
in Nil
  raise(Error.new("No response received from the NATS server when setting #{key.inspect} on KV #{bucket.inspect}"))
end

instance_methods.name: update
instance_methods.doc:
Update a bucket's key with the specified value only if the current value
is the specified revision. If this revision is the latest, the update is
not performed and this method returns `nil`.

```
if revision = kv.update(bucket, key, value, revision)
  # updated
else
  # outdated revision
end
```
instance_methods.summary: Update a bucket's key with the specified value only if the current value is the specified revision.
instance_methods.args_string: (bucket : String, key : String, value : String | Bytes, revision : Int) : Int64?
instance_methods.args_html: (bucket : String, key : String, value : String | Bytes, revision : Int) : Int64?

def.name: update
def.body:
validate_key!(key)
headers = Headers {"Nats-Expected-Last-Subject-Sequence" => revision.to_s}
case response = @nats.jetstream.publish("$KV.#{bucket}.#{key}", value, headers: headers)
in JetStream::API::V1::PubAck
  response.sequence
in JetStream::API::V1::ErrorResponse
  if response.error.err_code.stream_wrong_last_sequence?
    nil
  else
    raise(Error.new(response.error.description))
  end
in Nil
  raise(Error.new("No response received from the NATS server when updating #{key.inspect} on KV #{bucket.inspect}"))
end

instance_methods.name: watch
instance_methods.args_string: (bucket : String, key : String, *, ignore_deletes = false, include_history = false, &block : Entry, Watch -> )
instance_methods.args_html: (bucket : String, key : String, *, ignore_deletes = false, include_history = false, &block : Entry, Watch -> )

def.name: watch
def.body:
begin
  stop_channel = Channel(Nil).new
  watch = Watch.new(stop_channel)
  inbox = "$WATCH_INBOX.#{Random::Secure.hex}"
  deliver_group = Random::Secure.hex
  if include_history
    deliver_policy = JetStream::API::V1::ConsumerConfig::DeliverPolicy::All
  else
    deliver_policy = JetStream::API::V1::ConsumerConfig::DeliverPolicy::LastPerSubject
  end
  stream_name = "KV_#{bucket}"
  consumer = @nats.jetstream.consumer.create(stream_name: stream_name, deliver_subject: inbox, deliver_group: deliver_group, deliver_policy: deliver_policy, filter_subject: "$KV.#{bucket}.#{key}")
  subscription = @nats.subscribe(inbox, queue_group: deliver_group) do |msg|
    js_msg = JetStream::Message.new(msg)
    @nats.jetstream.ack(js_msg)
    operation = Entry::Operation::Put
    case msg.headers.try do |h|
      h["KV-Operation"]?
    end
    when "DEL"
      operation = Entry::Operation::Delete
    when "PURGE"
      operation = Entry::Operation::Purge
    end
    if (!ignore_deletes) || operation.put?
      _, bucket_name, key_name = msg.subject.split('.', 3)
      get = Entry.new(bucket: bucket_name, key: key_name, value: msg.body, revision: js_msg.stream_seq, created_at: js_msg.timestamp, delta: js_msg.pending, operation: operation)
      block.call(get, watch)
    end
  end
  stop_channel.receive
ensure
  if subscription
    @nats.unsubscribe(subscription)
  end
  if (stream_name && consumer) && (name = consumer.name)
    @nats.jetstream.consumer.delete(stream_name, name)
  end
end

constructors.name: new
constructors.args_string: (bucket, key, value, revision, created_at, operation, delta = 0_i64)
constructors.args_html: (bucket, key, value, revision, created_at, operation, delta = 0_i64)

def.name: new
def.body:
_ = allocate
_.initialize(bucket, key, value, revision, created_at, operation, delta)
if _.responds_to?(:finalize)
  ::GC.add_finalizer(_)
end
_

def.name: new
def.body:
_ = allocate
_.initialize(subject, body, reply_to, headers)
if _.responds_to?(:finalize)
  ::GC.add_finalizer(_)
end
_

instance_methods.name: body_io
instance_methods.summary: DEPRECATED Instantiating a new IO::Memory for each message made them heavier than intended, so we're now recommending using String.new(msg.body)

types.name: NotAReply
types.doc: Raised when trying to reply to a NATS message that is not a reply.
types.summary: Raised when trying to reply to a NATS message that is not a reply.

constructors.name: new
constructors.args_string: (subject, sid, queue_group, max_in_flight : Int = 10, &block : Message, Subscription -> )
constructors.args_html: (subject, sid, queue_group, max_in_flight : Int = 10, &block : Message, Subscription -> )

def.name: new
def.body:
_ = allocate
_.initialize(subject, sid, queue_group, max_in_flight, &block) do |_arg0, _arg1|
  yield _arg0, _arg1
end
if _.responds_to?(:finalize)
  ::GC.add_finalizer(_)
end
_

def.name: start
def.body:
spawn do
  begin
    remaining = @messages_remaining
    while remaining.nil? || remaining > 0
      message, on_error = message_channel.receive
      LOG.debug do
        "Calling subscription handler for sid #{sid} (subscription to #{subject.inspect}, message subject #{message.subject.inspect})"
      end
      call(message, on_error)
      remaining = @messages_remaining
    end
  rescue ex
  end
end
